intro: Campylospermum dependens var. integrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved campylospermum, is a shrub native to Australia. It features lance-shaped leaves that are entire, giving it a clean, unbroken appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Goodeniaceae family.
